## Description {#details}

This module defines functions that allow you to inspect the uses of a <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a>.

It is possible to obtain an <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#gab30423fe4582af30d65061fddc7398d7">LLVMUseRef</a> for any <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> instance. Each <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#gab30423fe4582af30d65061fddc7398d7">LLVMUseRef</a> (which corresponds to a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">llvm::Use</a> instance) holds a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user">llvm::User</a> and <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">llvm::Value</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Functions

### LLVMGetFirstUse() {#ga66a226d3d06ffada5c929656f4d97d35}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMUseRef LLVMGetFirstUse (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> Val)</>}>
Obtain the first use of a value.

Uses are obtained in an iterator fashion. First, call this function to obtain a reference to the first use. Then, call <a href="#ga6ea72661bcca2b77bea57173317ec942">LLVMGetNextUse()</a> on that instance and all subsequently obtained instances until <a href="#ga6ea72661bcca2b77bea57173317ec942">LLVMGetNextUse()</a> returns NULL.


<SectionUser title="See Also">
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#a413abcab8dbc3900fc2fde96a5d8fca6">llvm::Value::use&#95;begin()</a>
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h/#l02072">2072</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h">Core.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp/#l01174">1174</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp">Core.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### LLVMGetNextUse() {#ga6ea72661bcca2b77bea57173317ec942}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMUseRef LLVMGetNextUse (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#gab30423fe4582af30d65061fddc7398d7">LLVMUseRef</a> U)</>}>
Obtain the next use of a value.

This effectively advances the iterator. It returns NULL if you are on the final use and no more are available.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h/#l02080">2080</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h">Core.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp/#l01182">1182</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp">Core.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### LLVMGetUser() {#ga24f4b24c04a81ad75566021043f91848}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMValueRef LLVMGetUser (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#gab30423fe4582af30d65061fddc7398d7">LLVMUseRef</a> U)</>}>
Obtain the user value for a user.

The returned value corresponds to a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user">llvm::User</a> type.
